title: Field Hockey Field Goal Shooting Training: Game-Centered Learning-Based Simulation Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic hockey rules and experience with fundamental shooting techniques
context.additional_context: Small-scale game simulation applying Representative Learning Design (RLD) to enhance field goal shooting skills in an environment resembling actual game situations

learning_goals: Learners can execute field goal shots with accurate spatial awareness and timing in 7 out of 10 attempts during 3v3 small-sided games in a VR simulation environment.
Following the GCL (Game-Centered Learning) strategy, learners perform pass-shooting integrated plays with over 80% decision accuracy under pressure resembling actual matches.
Learners achieve a success rate of over 60% in five consecutive shooting attempts by utilizing non-verbal cues (coordination) with peers.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
